page.title: 19FARMING IN CORBRIDGE AREA
page.content: Farming in the Corbridge area is mixed,being cereal growing,cattle and sheep breeding.Wheat,barley and oats have been grown for many years but recent years has seen the introduction of oil seed rape,triticale,lupins and peas.The breeds of cattle have also changed enormously and the dairy herds now contain Shorthorns,Friesians and Holsteins.The beef herds also can muster several continental breeds such as Charolais and Limousin.The reason for the change is an attempt to reduce costs.After an absence of some 20 years the local agricultural show has been reintroduced.It is now called the Nothumberland County Show and is an important date in the calendar of the farming community.
